alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 28 at 3:33AM PST until December 29 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter Weather to Impact Mountain and Foothill Travel into Wednesday... .Mostly light snow will spread over Northern California today with some snow possibly occurring on the Valley floor in the Northern Sacramento Valley. Another round of moderate to heavy snow is expected tonight and Wednesday with continued low snow levels, again possibly down to the Valley floor in the Northern Sacramento Valley. Check road conditions before traveling. Some roads may remain closed or impassable. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...A break in the snow early this morning is not expected to last long. Snow is expected to redevelop over the area later this morning and this afternoon with new snow accumulations up to 3 inches. Periods of heavy snow are expected later tonight and Wednesday with additional accumulations from 8 to 20 inches. * WHERE...West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada. * WHEN...Until 10 PM Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Check road conditions before traveling. Many roads may remain closed or impassable. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
